definitions.definition: A blow, especially one given with the open hand, or with something broad and flat.
The sound of such a blow.

definitions.example: She slapped him in response to the insult.

definitions.definition: To cause something to strike soundly.
definitions.example: He slapped the reins against the horse's back.
The rain slapped against the window-panes.
We'd better slap some fresh paint on that wall.

definitions.definition: To impose a penalty, etc. on (someone).
definitions.example: I was slapped with a parking fine.

definitions.definition: To play slap bass on (an instrument).
A two-player reaction game in which opponents slap each other's hands.
